com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class ItemDropInputMode<T extends IModelItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.DropInputMode
      • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.ItemDropInputMode<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInputMode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NodeDropInputMode, StripeDropInputMode

    public class ItemDropInputMode<T extends IModelItem>
extends DropInputMode
    A DropInputMode providing a preview of the dragged item.

    A dragged IModelItem is visualized during the drag operation. In addition, this input mode supports snapping of the dragged IModelItem via the SnapContext and highlighting the DropTarget.

    Highlighting is done via a HighlightIndicatorManager.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.DropInputMode

      • cleanup

        protected void cleanup()
        Cleanup method that calls cleanupSnapContext(), cleanupPreview() and cleanupDropTarget().

        This method should be called for cleanup actions after a drag/drop gesture has been finished or canceled.

      • cleanupDropTarget

        protected void cleanupDropTarget()
        Cleans up the drop target and its highlighting.

        protected void cleanupPreview()
        Cleans up the item preview.

      • cleanupSnapContext

        protected void cleanupSnapContext()
        Cleans up the snap context.

      • collectSnapResults

        protected void collectSnapResults(Object source,
                                  CollectSnapResultsEventArgs args)
        Callback registered on the SnapContext that collects SnapResults for the dragged element.

        The default implementation doesn't collect any snap results.

        Parameters:
        source - The SnapContext this callback is registered at.
        args - The arguments describing the movement SnapResults shall be collected for.

      • getDraggedItem

        protected T getDraggedItem()
        Gets the currently dragged IModelItem instance.

        This implementation simply tries to cast the DropData to the type of the dragged items.

        Returns:
        The DraggedItem.

      • getDropTarget

        public final IModelItem getDropTarget()
        Gets the drop target at SnappedMousePosition.
        Returns:
        The DropTarget.
        See Also:
        isDropTargetHighlightEnabled(), setDropTarget(IModelItem)

      • getDropTarget

        protected IModelItem getDropTarget(PointD dragLocation)
        Returns the drop target at the specified location.

        The drop target is highlighted, if DropTargetHighlightEnabled is enabled. Per default, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        dragLocation - The location to return the drop target for.
        Returns:
        The drop target at the specified location or null if no drop target can be found.

      • getItemCreator

        public final IDropCreationCallback<T> getItemCreator()
        Gets the callback for item creation.

        Called by method onDragDropped(InputModeEventArgs).

        Returns:
        The ItemCreator.
        See Also:
        setItemCreator(IDropCreationCallback)

      • getPreviewGraph

        protected final IGraph getPreviewGraph()
        Returns the graph displayed as item preview.
        Returns:
        The preview graph or null if no preview is displayed at the moment.

      • getSnapContext

        public final SnapContext getSnapContext()
        The SnapContext which is used to snap the dragged element during the drag.

        If set to null (the default) this input mode tries to obtain the SnapContext from the IInputModeContext. To explicitly disable snapping, a SnapContext implementation that does nothing has to be set to this instance.

        Returns:
        The SnapContext.
        See Also:
        setSnapContext(SnapContext)

      • getSnappedMousePosition

        public final PointD getSnappedMousePosition()
        Gets the current snapped mouse position during drag operations.

        The position is returned in world coordinates according to the CanvasControl into which this input mode is installed. If SnappingEnabled is false, this value corresponds with MousePosition.

        Returns:
        The SnappedMousePosition.

      • initializeDropTarget

        protected void initializeDropTarget()
        Initializes the drop target.

      • initializePreview

        protected void initializePreview()
        Initializes the item preview.

        This method is called by onDragEntered(InputModeEventArgs). If a preview shall be displayed, the preview graph is initialized and populatePreviewGraph(IGraph) is called.

      • initializeSnapContext

        protected void initializeSnapContext()
        Initializes the snapping context.

        This method is called by onDragEntered(InputModeEventArgs)

      • onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated()
        Description copied from class: DropInputMode
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to false.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been deactivated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

        Overrides:
        onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated in class DropInputMode

      • setSnapContext

        public final void setSnapContext(SnapContext value)
        The SnapContext which is used to snap the dragged element during the drag.

        If set to null (the default) this input mode tries to obtain the SnapContext from the IInputModeContext. To explicitly disable snapping, a SnapContext implementation that does nothing has to be set to this instance.

        Parameters:
        value - The SnapContext to set.
        See Also:
        getSnapContext()

      • setSnappingEnabled

        public final void setSnappingEnabled(boolean value)
        Switches snapping on and off.
        Parameters:
        value - The SnappingEnabled to set.
        See Also:
        isSnappingEnabled()

      • updateDropTarget

        protected void updateDropTarget(PointD dragLocation)
        Calls getDropTarget(PointD) for SnappedMousePosition and sets the returned item as DropTarget.

        If DropTargetHighlightEnabled is enabled, the highlight is updated as well.

        Parameters:
        dragLocation - The location to update the drop target for.

      • updatePreview

        protected void updatePreview(IGraph previewGraph,
                             PointD dragLocation)
        Subclasses shall update the preview graph so the dragged item is displayed at the specified dragLocation.
        Parameters:
        previewGraph - The preview graph to update.
        dragLocation - The current drag location.
